classic.name: Jet d'Eau de Genève
classic.description: Iconic fountain, lit up at night, pumping half a cubic meter of water per second 140m into the air.

classic.name: Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques de Genève
classic.description: Seasonal tours are offered of the botanical garden & conservatory's flower & plant collections.

classic.name: Cathédrale Saint-Pierre Genève
classic.description: Cathedral most famous as the adopted home church of Protestant Reformation leader John Calvin.

classic.name: Bains des Pâquis
classic.description: Popular public bath houses on a pier in Lake Geneva that turn into saunas during winter.

classic.name: Palais des Nations
classic.description: United Nations office complex set in a park near the lake, with tours in many languages.
classic.address: 8, Av. de la Paix 14, 1202 Genève, Switzerland

classic.name: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire
classic.description: Built in 1910, Geneva's largest museum has items ranging from prehistoric finds to modern paintings.

classic.name: Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle
classic.description: Museum with displays on the Earth & human history, regional flora & fauna, plus science exhibitions.

classic.name: L'Horloge Fleurie
classic.description: Iconic outdoor flower clock designed in 1955, made with colorful blooms that change seasonally.

classic.name: Patek Philippe Museum
classic.description: Museum telling the story of Patek Phillippe & Swiss watchmaking from the 16th century to now.

classic.name: Broken Chair
classic.description: This 12m wooden sculpture of a broken chair serves to protest cluster bombs & land mines.

foodie.name: Restaurant Les Armures
foodie.description: Casual Swiss restaurant serving fondue, raclette & other classics in a chalet–inspired interior.

foodie.name: Auberge de Savièse
foodie.description: Fondue, raclette & other Swiss dishes offered in rustic, chalet-like surrounds with sidewalk tables.

foodie.name: Café du Soleil
foodie.description: A leafy terrace & timeless interior are the perfect accompaniment to Swiss food at this cafe.

foodie.name: Café de Paris - Chez Boubier
foodie.description: Warm spot offering French-inspired bistro creations & a diverse wine list in an old-world setting.

foodie.name: Boréal Coffee Shop
foodie.description: Coffee lovers have many options in this relaxed hangout that also serves teas, cakes & sandwiches.

foodie.name: Le Relais de l'Entrecôte
foodie.description: Classic family-friendly French eatery specializing in beef tenderloin & fries, plus varied desserts.

foodie.name: McDonald's Restaurant
foodie.description: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.

adventure.name: Parc de La Perle du Lac
adventure.description: Park known for dramatic views, with a biking & walking path, a playground & a fountain.

adventure.name: Parc La Grange
adventure.description: Large, lakeside park with scenic views, a rose garden & theater, plus a stage for summer concerts.

adventure.name: Bois de la Bâtie
adventure.description: Nature park featuring a zoo with local wildlife, plus a playground, splash pad & sports fields.
adventure.address: Chem. de la Bâtie, 1202 Genève, Switzerland

adventure.name: Parc des Evaux
adventure.description: Green space with rides for kids, grill pits & picnic tables, plus facilities for soccer & tennis.

adventure.name: Promenade de la Treille
adventure.description: This popular, elevated promenade boasts one of the longest benches in the world & scenic city views.
adventure.address: Rpe de la Treille, 1204 Genève, Switzerland

adventure.name: Jardin Anglais
adventure.description: The English-inspired landmark park features an 1862 fountain, a flower-clock sculpture & lake views.

adventure.name: Pointe de la Jonction
adventure.description: Relaxed riverfront hub for swimming & recreation with seasonal chair rentals & a small bar.

cultural.name: Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques de Genève
cultural.description: Seasonal tours are offered of the botanical garden & conservatory's flower & plant collections.

cultural.name: Grand Théâtre de Genève
cultural.description: Imposing, 19th-century theater staging an annual season of opera & dance productions.

cultural.name: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire
cultural.description: Built in 1910, Geneva's largest museum has items ranging from prehistoric finds to modern paintings.

cultural.name: Muséum d'Histoire Naturelle
cultural.description: Museum with displays on the Earth & human history, regional flora & fauna, plus science exhibitions.

cultural.name: Bâtiment des Forces Motrices
cultural.description: Lovingly renovated industrial space now housing a theater for major dramatic productions.

cultural.name: Patek Philippe Museum
cultural.description: Museum telling the story of Patek Phillippe & Swiss watchmaking from the 16th century to now.

cultural.name: International Museum of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
cultural.description: Permanent exhibition highlighting the ongoing humanitarian work of the Red Cross & Red Crescent.
cultural.address: Av. de la Paix 17, 1202 Genève, Switzerland

cultural.name: Tavel House
cultural.description: The story of urban Swiss life told over 6 floors of a medieval house once owned by the nobility.

cultural.name: Musée d'histoire des sciences de la Ville de Genève
cultural.description: Small museum in an 1830 villa showcasing permanent & temporary exhibits on the history of science.

cultural.name: Musée Ariana
cultural.description: Grand, neoclassical museum with a collection of 25,000 glass & ceramic items, plus an airy cafe.
cultural.address: Av. de la Paix 10, 1202 Genève, Switzerland

relaxation.name: Parc de La Perle du Lac
relaxation.description: Park known for dramatic views, with a biking & walking path, a playground & a fountain.

relaxation.name: Parc La Grange
relaxation.description: Large, lakeside park with scenic views, a rose garden & theater, plus a stage for summer concerts.

relaxation.name: Four Seasons Hotel des Bergues Geneva
relaxation.description: Polished rooms & suites in a luxury hotel with 2 refined restaurants, a posh spa & an indoor pool.

relaxation.name: La Réserve Genève Hotel and Spa
relaxation.description: Posh hotel with an outdoor pool, 3 restaurants & a bar, plus a cafe, tennis & a spa with a hammam.

relaxation.name: Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques de Genève
relaxation.description: Seasonal tours are offered of the botanical garden & conservatory's flower & plant collections.

relaxation.name: Bains des Pâquis

nightlife.name: Beau-Rivage Genève
nightlife.description: Storied 19th-century establishment with opulent rooms & suites, plus fine dining & a polished bar.

nightlife.name: El Catrín
nightlife.description: Traditional Mexican food & cocktails are showcased at this vibrant restaurant, which has a terrace.

nightlife.name: Hôtel Bristol Genève
nightlife.description: Upscale hotel in a 19th-century building offering a fine-dining restaurant & a spa area with saunas.

nightlife.name: Kiosque des Bastions
nightlife.description: Large city green space with a playground, 6 giant chess boards, lounge chairs & a botanical garden.

nightlife.name: Au Bureau
nightlife.address: Parking cinéma Pathé, 55A Av. Marie Curie, 74160 Archamps, France

nightlife.name: Hôtel Métropole Genève
nightlife.description: Sophisticated quarters in a lavish lodging with an Italian restaurant, a bar & a rooftop lounge.

trendy.description: A leafy terrace & timeless interior are the perfect accompaniment to Swiss food at this cafe.

trendy.name: Payot Libraire
trendy.address: Rue de la Confédération 7, 1204 Genève, Switzerland
